page.title: 09MORCHARD ROAD
page.content: Morchard Road is a small village on the main Exeter-Barnstaple road, where the road to Torrington turns off, and on the cross roads to Morchard Bishop and Down St Mary. The garage is the main business in the village today. It sells food and drink as well as petrol. The pub next door is called the Sturt Arms, after the family who were originally Lords of the Manor. It has been a pub for well over a hundred years. At the beginning of this century there was also a slaughter house at the pub. The other main business today is the saw mill, where Mr Frank Howard makes seats, tables, name plates, etc. The Station is unmanned nowadays, but trains stop by request. The building is used as a house.
